name: 數位學習與資訊素養
description: This seminar is designed to provide a foundational overview of theories and research on e-learning for seniors and intergenerationality. Topics to be covered include the differences between traditional learning and e-learning, culture, gender, and individual differences regarding online learning, acceptance and barriers of technology use for older adults as well as digital games for intergenerational learning. To maximize the benefit that students get from the seminar, students are required to complete a review regarding each topic before class. Aside from pre-course readings, students are required to engage in guided in-class activities and discussions. Also, in order to cultivate students’ ability to raise an issue, address a research question, and develop a research proposal, at the end of the seminar, a mini-conference activity is built into the course.
goals: Understand the trend of digital learning and its application in adult teaching
Able to ask questions about doubtful points in the paper and express ideas courageously.
Be able to propose research topics and methods for the field of digital learning.

grading.note:
Attendance and Class Participation
Attendance is required. Repeated failure to attend lectures or discussion may result in a lowered semester grade. Participation in class discussions also counts. 

Students will be required to complete a review and raise a question regarding weekly topics before class. In doing so, students will earn points each week for their contributions to class discussions.

Examples: 
	2~3(points)*4(Reading Previews) = 8~12 points
	Raising one good question or discussion will earn 1 extra point. If you participate in class discussions 10 times thorough the whole semester, you will get 10 points.

Collaborative/ Group-based Project(Paper Reading & Wise Aging Life)
1.	Paper Reading
This assignment will be marked as collaborative or group-based. Students must work with the other members in the group including hosting discussion or presenting in class. Each group is required to select a topic related to e-learning and review latest research papers for class discussion.
2.Aging Smart Together
(1)Please investigate at least three organizations or groups that provide senior services with digital technology. (2)Also explore the special issues and problems when we provide services or design digital devices for older adults may keep in mind. What are your solutions? Present the findings with your classmates on Week 3 & Week 6.

Mini Conference: Oral Presentation
Each student is required to propose his research ideas or questions and discuss with the lecturer during the midterm week. Research topics may focus on relevant theories or methods in the fields of e-learning. Please submit the abstract onto MOODLE in the 12th week and be prepared to share them at the end of the semester. 

Try to limit the abstract to a short paragraph (about 300 words) and prepare for a 10-15 min presentation. Each abstract and presentation will be graded based on clarity, coherence, relevance, and originality.
